clinical_study.brief_title: EndoMaster EASE System for Treatment of Colorectal Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Single Arm Study to Assess the Safety and Performance of the EndoMaster EASE System for the Treatment of Colorectal Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, single arm study to assess the safety and performance of the EndoMaster EASE (Endoluminal Access Surgical Efficacy) System for the treatment of patients with colorectal neoplasms.

detailed_description.textblock: Prospective, single arm study to assess the safety and performance of robotically assisted ESD of superficial colorectal lesions, that otherwise cannot be optimally and radically removed by snare-based techniques

primary_outcome.description: rate of complete (R0) resection defined as en bloc, one-piece resection with histologically confirmed tumour-free lateral and vertical margins

secondary_outcome.measure: Bleeding during or after the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding as evidence by Active bleeding during the robotic ESD procedure Bleeding after ESD with clinical evidence of 1. Fresh hematemesis; 2. Passage of tarry stool with pulse > 100 or systolic blood pressure < 100; 3. Drop in hemoglobin level of > 4 g/dl
Perforation at the ESD site as assessed by endoscopy
Clinical sepsis with changes in inflammatory markers as evidence by clinical symptoms of fever, pulse > 100 radiological evidence of intraperitoneal collection elevated WBC count of > 10.0
renal failure as evidence of derangement of renal function with elevated creatinin level > 100 mmol/l
Serous Adverse Events at preocedure and through discharge

Device malfunction and Use errors during the ESD procedure as evidence by cessation of the function of the EndoMASTER EASE system need to use of the immediate cessation button for the EndoMASTER EASE system
En bloc resection rate / R0 rate / positive vertical margin / positive lateral margin
Healing of operative site / presence of suspicious tissue for biopsy / presence of stricture

secondary_outcome.measure: Cancer status by cross-sectional imaging (MRI / CT)
secondary_outcome.description: local recurrence / recurrence at different site in colon / metastatic disease and location
en bloc, one-piece excision of the neoplasm irrespective of histopathology, in the absence of device-related SAE through 30 days

arm_group.description: Treatment of early colorectal neoplasia / lateral spreading tumors by ESD using EndoMASTER EASE robotic system

intervention.intervention_name: EndoMASTER EASE Robotic system for ESD
intervention.description: EndoMaster EASE System, is a robotic-assisted endoscopy system indicated for endoscopic visualization and therapeutic access to the adult gastrointestinal (GI) tract for endoscopic surgery
